website_summaries.verdict: Featuring sides that pop out for extra space and a sturdy frame to prevent escape, this carrier lets your pet travel safely and feel comfortable.
pros: Straps include one that attaches to top of rolling suitcase so cases can be kept together, while another clips to car seat belt
Large area of screened-in windows that allow pet to look around and not feel as confined
Comes with a collapsible travel food bowl
cons: While more than 1 pet will fit when the sides are expanded, only 1 will travel comfortably –unless very small – when sides are closed

customer_reviews.title: Life Saver!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing! My cat is 9.5 lbs and can stretch all the way out in it when unfolded and comfortably lay in the center when folded up. He likes it so much he willingly hangs out in it. He had an injury and it was the perfect way to keep him off his feet but not feeling as cooped up as a crate. Plus all the ways you can open the screens allowed for me to pet him easily when stressed without him escaping! It's very sturdy too and folds up for easy storage!
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: I went on vacation and the cage worked great it unzips to make more than enough space for ...
customer_reviews.text: I went on vacation and the cage worked great it unzips to make more than enough space for my jack russell terrior who is about 16 inch tall and weighs 19 pounds. The cage fit fine on the plane and she was comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: My Malteses loves It!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd purchase of a similar product. The first was a smaller size when my 2 Malteses were just puppies, 2nd about the same size but only 1 expansion side and my pups loved both of them. So when I saw that they now have 2 expansion sides I decided to buy a 3rd. My pups were so eager to get in the crate when I got it out of the Amazon box! My Maltese are about 8-10lbs each and this sized crate would fit one comfortably but they did try to get in it together lol.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter to transport her cat to Prague, Czech Republic. It arrived Monday. She left this morning (Wednesday) and packed her cat in it for the first time. Her cat weights 12 lbs. The first leg of her trip was from Kansas City to Charlotte, NC. By the time she arrive in Charlotte, the shoulder strap had broken on both ends. It did't even last two hours. Because she is on her way out of the country, I won't even be able to return it. This carrier is not travel quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haven't even used yet, it's broken!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new bag tried to use for the first time on my trip this morning, found out on one side, the metal rail broke thru and torn up the inside of the bag. Had to take the rail out. But without it, it collapse on one side. Total disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Bag had a flaw and is now falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Not good at all. Bought because of the positive reviews, however my bag arrived with a flaw/bad seam on the top side of bag. Reached out to company via amazon and hadn’t heard back. Tried to make the best of the bag, as I didn’t have time to buy another before our trip. Bag Is now falling apart after one use/trip. Metal rod is now sticking out of top portion of bag. Not happy at all. Not sure it deserves any stars.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Be wary of it working with your airline
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to some of the reviews stating this carrier is too large for most airlines to fit under the seats. After receiving the 2 carriers I decided there was no way they would fit under seats on Southwest. They are too firm to be pushed down to fit the 1.5" difference in max height requirement. The carriers would be great for other purposes, however, I would NOT recommend getting them for airline travel. I emailed the seller and after waiting a few days for a response, I called Amazon and they worked with me to return them.
customer_reviews.author: loocie

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder strap ripped off!
customer_reviews.text: After I had received this item I placed it down and opened it up so that the cats could find it on their own and try it out. If I would have shown it to them they never would have laid in it. After a few days of them in and out of it, I placed one of the cats inside, zipped it up and lifted it by the shoulder strap. The stitching holding the strap to bag came undone causing me to almost drop my cat! I will be returning this item and getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend! It allows air flow and plenty of room. Both my kitties like to go in there and snuggle up when I have the sides popped out. Only enough room for one cat when sides zipped up but that is exactly what I expected. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: JodieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: We were flying Egypt Air business class and it fit under the seat in front of us set up like this with plenty of room inside for two 5-6 ...
customer_reviews.text: Two 4 month kittens traveled from Cairo to New York in this carrier with one side folded out. We were flying Egypt Air business class and it fit under the seat in front of us set up like this with plenty of room inside for two 5-6 pound kittens. They travel in the car with both sides folded out so they plenty of mesh to look out of and watch the world go by.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: My chorkie loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 lbs Chihuahua Yorkie mix loves this carrier! We use it when we travel on the airplane. He likes it so much that sometimes he doesn't even want to come out of it after we land. My only complaint is that it says it fits underneath all airline seats, but it is actually a very tight fit on Southwest planes. It sort of sticks out a little bit from under the seat. One flight attendant actually told me it was too big, but I also feel like she was being quite rude and picky.
customer_reviews.author: Jeana Mascio

customer_reviews.title: My cat got out the carrier with great ease and I was unable to fly as scheduled
customer_reviews.text: the carrier is not secure. My cat got out the carrier with great ease and I was unable to fly as scheduled. The zippers are not secure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IMPROVED PRODUCT... LOVE IT MORE THAN BEFORE
customer_reviews.text: If you are reading old reviews before may 2019, then it's not accurate. They improved their product a whole lot and its worth a try. The red/black is one I bought in May 2019. The orange/gray is the new one I got today and wow I did not expect I would get an upgraded version of last year. I wanted to buy this again because I hate giving one of my cats a bad bag and the other with a good bag. But now this company improved the bag an insane amount. It's so much more sturdy than the last which you could see in the photos. Now I'm debating in buying another one 😑.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Armando Perez

customer_reviews.title: Collapses on my cat
customer_reviews.text: When sides are unfolded the top collapses on my cat, The pictures show it open and standing but it collapses like a duffle bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fell a part
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, sharp looking pet carrier. I bought it on may 8 and transported my 3 months kitten from breeder via plane to home and two times to the vet, the shoulder strap buckle fell off, and many holes in the nets. The carrier is not useful and my kitten, Cheeto is a Bengal kitten not a a wild cheetah, I contacted the company to see what is their customer service will handle this issue. I will update my review once I hear from pet peppy. Update on August 9th. : never heard back from pet peppy, any product has that name I will avoid.
customer_reviews.author: A. Amin

customer_reviews.title: Roomy
customer_reviews.text: This was wonderful for transporting my cat when I moved from Florida to North Carolina. Thanks to the sides being able to expand, he had room sprawl out and get comfy. He’s a big kitty too. Weighed 18 lbs when we moved (14 now). Thought I’d add that in if anyone has a big cat & is considering buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Samus

customer_reviews.title: Main part missing on both sides....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea but the actual part that expands is missing on both sides, ergo, the sides only fold down 3/4ths of the way. How goofy is that? I'm not pleased with the quality either. Seems a tad cheap for this price. $$$ I'd add a photo but I've wasted enough time with this thing. Maybe this was made during Chinese New Year and everybody came to work sloshed...🥂
customer_reviews.author: M M

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: My order came on time w/a nail trimmer not the collapsable cup I looked forward to receiving. The carrier has the side belt for easy towing on suitcase, a plus when traveling. I purchased the product for the pop out tents that extend the room capacity providing comfort for your pet- that's important, the happier they are the more relaxed you both are. It's a great product, I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Save your money! On dogs for 60 years! Never seen such a flimsy carrier
customer_reviews.text: After it’s completely zipped and on the floor my dog loved the little porches... but it is the flimsiest carrier I have ever seen! Just trying to get it zipped together is a challenge because it’s constantly falling over and falling apart. I can’t even begin to imagine the reviews I read were people stuck to sizable dogs in this carrier together! My dogs 3 pounds and I could’ve stuck another 3 pound dog in there but that’s about it especially for A trip with any length to it. But it’s not worth the money! There are many many carriers that have that zip open porch design that are very sturdy and very nice for only $10 more
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: You need This one for in cabin air travel
customer_reviews.text: I had to do a last minute emergency transport by air and selected this pet peppy airline approved. The expandable sides are Genius who designed it? During layover the kitty had room too stretch out and relax. Also the netting allowed for a cooling of kitty as my departure place was in the triple digits. Other pluses are the snaps on the zippers and the collapsible water dish. My Only criticism is that the mesh could be sturdier as I could see Some cats could eventually chew through it.! Since I bought this carrier and mentioned it on Facebook several of my friends immediately purchased one!
customer_reviews.author: Misha Nogha

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the carrier for our ferret so she can ride with us in the car. As soon as I set it up she went in and investigated for about 20 minutes then stretched out and went to sleep! We keep it open in the house so she can go in when she likes, which she does. I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 only because we haven't actually used it yet to travel so I'm not sure of the durability, however, it is put together very well. It exceeded my expectations on the craftsmanship, and she loves the furry floor inside.
customer_reviews.author: evjones

customer_reviews.title: Good travel carrier
customer_reviews.text: We relocated and had to drive 3 days with a cat who doesn’t travel. This carrier gave her enough room and kept her secure in the back seat with our dog. The expanding design is smart. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is all the zippers. It makes expanding and folding more complicated. It would also be great if the padded floor board fit better once the carrier is open. And if the furry liner could be removed for washing. But overall this was a great fit for our cat. I haven’t tried it on a plane, so I can’t speak to how it fits under a seat.
customer_reviews.author: Kindlekid

customer_reviews.title: Not cool! Horrible blue and yellow logo that u don't ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased in dark gray color and payed more for that. I received a black one. Made with cheap materials and poorly made. It doesn't stand up with all the sides open! I paid $40 and received the one sold for $34. Not cool! Horrible blue and yellow logo that u don't see in the pictures. This item look good on pictures, it seems very low quality and cheap in person. It shouldn't be selling for more than $20 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gold

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase! Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this purchase! It's exactly as described! It's perfect for our minilop Bun (under 3 pounds) who will be flying in November in it due to its size specifications are applicable to United airlines pet policy. The mesh is durable, it opens on the top and side! It included a pair of nail clippers that we just used to clip his nails for the first time. Padded, it's just what we needed!!! He's very happy too! He's at a local brewery in picture. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda H. Murray

customer_reviews.title: but photos make it look like it'd work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for my cat, who is not small, but photos make it look like it'd work. There isn't any kind of structure, so the top would slump down, and the sides can only be expanded if you unzip the inside and then the outside, which doesn't work for a cat who doesn't like carriers. Would recommend for small dogs ( toys, and terrier size), kittens and very small cats.
customer_reviews.author: TheLibrarian

customer_reviews.title: Cozy and spacious
customer_reviews.text: This carrier was perfect. We picked up a new pup and traveled with her effortlessly with this carrier! It was tall enough for the pup, while small enough to fit under the airplane seat. The expandable sides was perfect to allow the pup to stretch out during the flight while she slept! The inside is lined with cozy fuzzy material that the pup could snuggle on. We had many compliments on the carrier from other people on the flight and the flight attendants. Absolutely zero complaints about this! The collapsible bowl that comes with the carrier was perfect for our airport time. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Cook

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous--strap broke, could have hurt my dog
customer_reviews.text: This kennel is a nice size but the first time we used it the clip holding the shoulder harness broke. Luckily I spotted it tearing when we were going through the airport. If it had come lose our dog would have been badly injured. Unfortunately, I can't return it. Just warning others not to buy this. UPDATE: I contacted the company and they made it right and refunded me the cost of this item. I am certain they will be addressing this flaw.
customer_reviews.author: likes sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome carrier
customer_reviews.text: This was one of my better buys. Moved across the country and flew to new home. American Airlines accepted as a approved carrier at the airport. Fit under the seat. After take off, unzipped one side (like a tent). My cat was super comfortable and slept the entire trip. First time he flew. Comes with a soft fluffy pad. I added plastic garbage bag on bottom and towel on top of pad, in case he soiled the bed during the flight. My boy is 10 pounds and it was a sturdy carrier for him. So much better than the hard shell carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There are a LOT of zippers
customer_reviews.text: This pet carrier has a lot going for it - it is light, appears fairly sturdy, should be comfortable, and is expandable. Your pet is accessible from three different directions, and there is an inside strap that should prevent escapes. That said, it has a lot of zippers that need to be zipped and unzipped for various uses. The one thing I would suggest is that, instead of zippers to attach and detach the cushioning on the sides, the manufacturer might want to think about using Velcro to eliminate two of the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Lady

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this for my dog and when it arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my dog and when it arrived I opened it, inspected it, and put it right back in the box. The zippers to the tent portion were closed, but split open in the middle meaning the teeth aren't strong and don't grab properly. I found a hole in the top where the stitching didn't come close to the piping and was missed completely. It has limited support in the frame and sags in the front even with the back closed. It was in my house for 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: rmsbirm

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier, very inventive and practical
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful little carrier. I needed to take a very long drive with a very young kitten and this was a terrific way to do it. It can be a closed, secure and soft place to hide and a way to be in the middle of all the action with a few zips or unzips. No doubt this will be used a great deal, and thrilled that it is airline approved for carry on. After two days in his new home it is currently being enjoyed as a "safe place" while the little guy gets used to new surroundings. It's his fort, his launching pad and I hope to edit this review shortly with a picture. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Seider

customer_reviews.title: Decent carrier with one issue
customer_reviews.text: I used this carrier on a flight, it's lightweight, easy to carry in hand or over the shoulder and is well built. I also liked having the pockets to put treats and other cat stuff. My cat was generally comfortable in this but she could not stand without opening the extra side doors (she is average size) thus she had to lie down the entire flight unless I opened the top for her for a short period of time. That's why only 4/5 stars. Also, it will not fit under the seat in front of you, but realistically no carrier will without making it uncomfortable for the animal unless it's a very small dog or young cat.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied puppy customer
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this. My new dog was flying for the first time and worried how she was going to be. Having the option to unzip sides to create an expansion made it much more comfortable for her. I’m a short person so I was able to give her some of my leg room letting her bag expand for more room to wiggle around and stretch out more. I also used it as a crate on road for when I needed to leave the room and couldn’t take her (also required for cleaning service). I also like the fact it had a little Sherpa liner inside so you don’t need to buy extra items to keep em comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Hipolito

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: This carrier fell apart before I even got my cat into the box! The pull handle would not stay clipped. I tried to glue it with gorilla glue and that didn't work at all. I ended up tying a rope to the frame so I could use it for what I purchased it for. I looked ghetto walking through the airport! THANKS! I would have returned the product had I had the time to.
customer_reviews.author: natalie Frinchaboy

customer_reviews.title: Picky anxious chihuahua approved
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a chance to use our carrier for memorial day weekend . It was our first time traveling with our new pet and we were a bit stressed about how he would handle flying as well as the carrier. Well he must have liked it quite a bit because of all the three of us he slept the best on the red eye. He was not keen being zipped up in it but once in was quite comfortable both times. Really liked the collapsible bowl and nail clippers. We did find opening the inner fur liners a bit cumbersome to both open and close. Besides that quite happy with carrier .
customer_reviews.author: California Poppy

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice carrier and well made otherwise but is useless to ...
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is too big to go under a seat on United Airlines and I can't imagine that it complies with any of the major carrier guidelines. I found out the hard way by boarding with my pet in the carrier. It is a nice carrier and well made otherwise but is useless to me if I can't use it for airline travel. The merchant responded but didn't offer an explanation as to why it is advertised as "Airline Approved" and said that was the only size they offer.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken, smaller than I expected, but easy to return
customer_reviews.text: It was alright, but I had to return mine because the bottom roller arrived broken. It was much smaller than I thought and could not even fit one of my fat cats comfortably. (I read somewhere that it would be able to fit two cats, so that's why I got it, for both of mine). It wasn't roomy enough and my cat was freaking out in it. It would definitely be great for smaller animals. I liked the design and the zipper expanders, just didn't work for me unfortunately. Luckily it was easy to return!
customer_reviews.author: Taj Lane

customer_reviews.title: This carrier is awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this carrier for our new puppy...we have it open for her to use as her "house" on a regular basis...she loves to grab her toys or chew bones and go lay on her "Deck" (the front door flap) and just hang out there. When she is ready for a nap, she will crawl inside and lay down on the soft fabric that is also part of the side when it is folded up and used as a carrier. We are very pleased with this product!! Some of the reviews mentioned an odor...we did NOT have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Compact storage/expands into VERY ROOMIE!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these! Neighbor borrowed one to take 2 aggressive kittens to the Animal shelter just before closing. She was upset because she had wanted to keep them, but they were too wild and nasty. When she asked for the carrier back the next day, they said they didn’t have it anymore! (Apparently, somebody working at the shelter got a nice free carrier to take home, because it didn’t just evaporate into thin air!). I need to buy another!
customer_reviews.author: Margo A.

customer_reviews.title: America Airlines Approved and it’s Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My fur baby loves it! It was used with American Airlines. It fits perfectly but if you expand one side during the flight it won’t be all the way under the seat. It’s sturdy and it did have a smell fresh out the package, so I washed it and drowned it with unstoppables and fabric conditioner to get rid of the smell and it worked. In the car, you can use the seatbelt to lock it in place. Overall this is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: iLadyC

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED-the mesh is weak and other issues
customer_reviews.text: This product lasted exactly one week without my puppy chewing through the mesh. It also didn't come with a collapsible water bowl, but came with nail trimmers, which wasn't what compromised the mesh. This would be an ok carrier for a bigger dog with bigger teeth but not a puppy with sharp teeth. It does not have a storage pocket either, but a strap for a seatbelt...I was ok with that compromise, but I did need a bowl and pocket for the bowl I never received.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Our 11-pound Shih Tzu enjoys his new pet carrier. There are so many options to expand or collapse the carrier! I really like the padding and all of the various zippers to access different parts of the carrier! We're using it not only as a carrier on the plane, but also in its expanded setup as a pet crate while on vacation - saving us the hassle of bringing the full-size crate (even though the full rate is collapsible, this carrier is so much easier to carry and is just as comfortable)!
customer_reviews.author: Escapee

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Works well but don’t love the interior insert matetial.
customer_reviews.text: This works well for our 9 pound yorkie. It’s a little snug, but we use it in our camper if we leave for a little bit. Luckily my dog likes to curl up in a tiny ball, so this size works for us. Only issue is that the faux fur material used on the inside made my dog sweat and break out with hot spots really bad. So I either have to take out the insert or add a terry cloth town or a separate dog bed. So that really sucks. I wish the material was something else that wasn’t so hot.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Okay product for the price
customer_reviews.text: We use this for a trip to Europe, overall the product did well on the trip but the general build quality was a bit light. We found ourselves being very careful with the bag to make sure it didn't get damaged on the trip. Access to the expanding sides was difficult, you have to access the zippers from inside the bag which can lead to the dog jumping out and adds stress to the dog when you have to put them back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Robert&Laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for air travel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a flight where I’d be bringing both of my small dogs. I didn’t realize the wheels were detachable, so that was good because they made it too tall to fit under the seat otherwise. The only thing I didn’t like was the handle that attaches to the wheels wasn’t very sturdy. It feels like it might snap or break at any point. It was great for getting through the airport quickly, just not sure if it’ll last.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar T.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long flights. Check with airline first to make sure it fits on your particular plane.
customer_reviews.text: This pet carrier was a life saver on my flight from Oregon to Germany. My cat was really comfortable and was able to stretch out on the flight. Technically this carrier would not fit on the international flight so I had to buy a tiny Amazon Basics carrier for that leg of the flight. Luckily the airplane was not full and I was able to keep her in this carrier even though it would not fit under the seat. I can’t imagine what the trip would have been like in the tiny carrier.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waten

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is kinda ok for our two small cats. But the large ones.... forget it. The issue isn't really fitting, the cats do fit, but the strength of the carrier. Our 14.5lb-er who doesn't like the vet punched through the top, although maybe he just pulled the zipper back, in any case, he made his escape and it took a bit of doing to get back to the car ( in our hard shell case ). I am still looking for a sturdy cordura soft shell case that contains the big cats, without the fancy folding sides this one has.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a move I’ll be taking my cats on a flight. One of my cats is very fat so I needed wheels to carry her through and airport. The material that’s lining the inside of the carrier is super soft the bottom portion is removable so you can clean it. There are multiple entry points to get your cat in or out. The only questionable thing is the mash it seems like it may be easily terrible but we’ll see how it holds up when the time comes
customer_reviews.author: SHAAUUNAA

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely my love my dog carrier. My dog is spoiled and has never been caged, I opened and put together in about 4 minutes, set it on the floor and my dog walked in sniffed around and sat down. My dog loved the carrier. It is pretty, sturdy, light weight and perfect for our trip, worth every dime, and the price was extremely reasonable. Haven't tried with the wheels yet, I may not need them my dog weighs 7 lbs, but I wanted to option for a more hands free carrier. Kudos to the company that made this dog carrier.
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA SORENSEN

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy travel bag for small dog.
customer_reviews.text: My pup is a little escape artist and the clip inside is so helpful. It was perfect for the plane ride made him feel safe when we weren't at home. He would often go inside it when not sealed inside so that he could nap safely away from all the activities. The little bowl included also proved very helpful in the airport as a travel water bowl. Our pup is a 9lb poodle/terrier mix who has scratched at the door and it held up. The clips on the zippers are also helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: The BEST!
customer_reviews.text: This soft sided carrier is far nicer than our first and was 10 bucks cheaper. This one is a bit larger but I feel sure will still fit under the seat on the plane and until then the extra room is nice for going to the vet. When fully closed it does not have any mesh showing on the sides, so less mesh to tear if you have a kitty prone to clawing--we do--and the mesh is thicker. For 29.97 I'll buy another and just give the tiny-first-carrier to a shelter. I'm waiting for it to go down in price...
customer_reviews.author: C. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: great concept just a little large for airline
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept and actually bought to transport two small puppies on the plane. works as described and manipulating in the airport was a breeze. Just a tad too tall for under the seats. Did use the expanding sides while in the air and was very helpful and easy to use. the wheeled base was really easy to use and take off and fold on the plane . if the could redesign one side to collapse down for initial take off so fits under seat better the bag would be perfect. As a whole I had nothing but compliments and only complain was mine about it being a bit too tall.
customer_reviews.author: Golden Mom

customer_reviews.title: Some design challenges...
customer_reviews.text: The pet carrier was as advertised, lightweight and functional however opening the side panels was difficult as the zipper tabs are located behind the fluffy liner panel. Also one of the 2-way zippers got off track....had to repair and pin it, hoping it stays together. All that being said, my 11 pound puppy seems to be happy and relaxed while in it and ON it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this!
customer_reviews.text: My 15lb shitzu loves this bag for just sleeping or hanging out. He brings his toys in with him. He loves it so much that he managed to paw at the expandable mesh and put a hole in it I haven’t used it to fly with, although I really want to try. I purchased it with the wheels I case that will be easier. It fits him perfectly with lots of room to spare as you can see from the photos. I would be curious if anyone has used this with the wheels on flights.
customer_reviews.author: Kira

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these pet carries (2) for an 11+ hour flight with 2 layovers/connections, and I have to say, this bag made all the difference! We were able to expand the carries during flight/layovers so our dogs could stretch out. ! of our guys hates being enclosed, and he did pretty good in the expanded carrier. One nice thing was the ability to open one side, slide it under the seat, leaving the carrier at my feet, opening the other side and making myself as comfortable as possible with my feet on either side of the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Semaj

customer_reviews.title: just wanted to let you know how happy I was when I received my expandable pet carrier
customer_reviews.text: Hi Jack, just wanted to let you know how happy I was when I received my expandable pet carrier. EXACTLY as described, sturdy, roomy and compact. Impressive extras like the soft plush inside pads and clip to secure to pet collar for extra safety. My daughter will be driving for 8 hours to a new city and job with Miles her cat by her side. Miles is very fearful and skittish & HATES his hard pet carrier. It will be so much more relaxing for Miles & my daughter for him to be be in a save soft roomy carrier with plenty and opportunity to see each other during the trip. Excellent product. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Navigatethewinds/Marie

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great, for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 12lb mini Bernedoodle puppy (who is now 17lb). The longer shoulder strap gave out pretty much immediately, but the shorter straps on the side are quite sturdy. I love this carrier because there are plenty of zippered openings, and it has a strap on the inside that keeps your pet tethered to the carrier. It's great to have the zipper compartment on the top of the carrier because my dog will NOT just walk in on her own. I just used this on an airplane and it doesn't REALLY fit under the seat... but it was good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rabbits loved it, just wish it was easier to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carrier. I brought both of my rabbits across the country in this. The door is a great size and it is nice to also have a opening on top. My rabbits loved the fuzzy bottom. The only negative is that the fuzzy parts on the expandable sides do no zip off making it difficult to clean any accidents. pros- expandable, keeps it shape, soft bottom. cons-fuzzy lining on sides are not removable making it difficult to clean. suggestions- lining on the expanders should have a double sided zipper, so you could close it from the side or in the main compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Sommers

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: It’s actually super sturdy and huge! I got it for my rabbits because I have been moving apartments a lot the past few years and I always feel so bad when they would sometimes b in their carrying case for a several hours on the drive and setting things up. They actually love this thing! And it’s way more study than i expected I was worried it would be flimsy and break down quickly like things I have bought in the past but it’s super high quality I’m very glad I purchased this very happy best purchase in a while! Definitely buy this
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Friedman

customer_reviews.title: Did not Work for Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this way in advance as I planned a trip in Dec. and what a disappointment it was for me-the bottom fell apart the first leg of my trip then I screwed it down tighter for the trip home and it fell apart again and again..I am out of the US and I really thought I found a carrier to help me-I was so upset a I had to carry the carrier with my precious cargo inside...This item doesn't deserve one star.....
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a good price!
customer_reviews.text: It made traveling with a petite cat super easy! She was able to get comfortable during the long wait in the airport, but it condensed down to be within carry on guidelines. It did not fit entirely under the seat on my Delta flight (super boo!) But I made do. I would like there to be a more convenient way to lay down the fleece liner on the expandable part so that there is limited risk of the per escaping. I was very fortunate my feline travel companion was easy going! All in all: a great product for a great price! I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Pros: this is the roomiest carrier I could find that still fit under the airplane seat. (It only fits under the middle seat. Sorry window people) Cons: quality. The strap holding it to the suitcase ripped on the first leg of the journey causing my kitties to flop off rather and a traffic jam on the jet way as I scrambled to collect them. I’ll still use it for the return trip but I’ll have to use the rollers it came with as it’s too difficult to carry without jostling them around otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: aparks08

customer_reviews.title: Pet travel convenience
customer_reviews.text: This pet carrier is the perfect size for my 3 month old kitten (3lbs). She will have enough room to chase her tail, play with her balls and feather bird. When it expands there is even more room for her to be comfortable. There are a ton of zippers on the bag. If you are not careful you can open the wrong Superman’s your pet will get out so be careful with what zipper opens what. I love the fact that a small collapsible bowl comes with the bag. The bag is soft enough to bend when needed and stand strong when required. My kitten felt comfy on the fur lining and started to knead. No regrets on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannine L. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Seems like there is lots of room to keep doggie comfy
customer_reviews.text: For the farm Dog who hates kernels.... She sure seems to LOOOOOVE her new little carrier, lol. She actually hasn't gotten out of it since it arrived. My mini Manchester Terrier is kinda thick, at 17lbs, (and a bit taller&longer than an average female cat) so I was concerned about her fitting a carrier that is airline approved. I think this should work just fine. The little bowl include was a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Tko

customer_reviews.title: Works Great and Pretty Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like the carrier except for when the wings are closed there is only the top and one end that has the mesh and allows air flow. If you are traveling and cannot open the wings that can make it pretty stuffy for the pet. However, if the sides could also be mesh the I could unzip the furry sides and fold them under the bottom cushion which would allow for more airflow, even if the mesh wings were folded up as usual. I would have been happier if I that was an option as well.
customer_reviews.author: RealArt

customer_reviews.title: Great travel case
customer_reviews.text: We had an older version of this travel case but it’s time expired. So we had to purchase a. Ew one for an upcoming flight across country. Our 20 pound do I cloned in it as soon as I unpacked it on the floor so I guess she gave it 5 stars. What’s. Ew is the two sides that provide more space when your not on an airplane I feel this is a good purchase. 5 woofs.
customer_reviews.author: Lowell P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice carrier, but the wheel frame doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered was missing the pins to keep the handlebar locked in place. So I ordered a replacement. The second one had a faulty screw which broke the plastic the first time I moved the handlebar, making the whole wheel frame useless. It’s too bad because the carrier case itself is nice, and I like the expandable sides. But the wheel part is sketchy, and after two different attempts, I’m giving up on this one, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: K Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Carrey Case for Cat Retired after one Trip.
customer_reviews.text: On the flight to our destination, A metal rod from the top of the Carrey Case slipped out of the seem about 3 inches. I pulled the loose rod out thinking my big cat might get poked with it. We still used the Carrey Case for the return trip. When we arrived to our destination the second rod from the top was starting to peak out of the seem. "You need to reinforce the two RODS so the ends don't peek out and possible hurting the cats. Cats don't stay still all the time. This Carrey Case is retired.
customer_reviews.author: KENNETH B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 pups! Fits on Southwest Airlines
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I have 2 chi's, 9 lb and 4 lb. Both fit comfortably in this carrier. The expanding sides are so nice! Pups have 2 'porches'. One on each side. The full mesh on the other ends allows pups to see out. The zippers are a bit crazy, so I put marked zipper pulls on certain zippers to make it easier. Would like all zippers to be double zippers. This size fits under Southwest seats with some squishing, which the carrier allows. It is tough to open sides when under seat. Carrier folds to about 3 inches height for storage. Would be nice for carrier to have wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Rahna

customer_reviews.title: Airline approved, great features, but not the sturdiest carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Great carrier. Airline approved. But please take note of the following issues: 1) When the sides are opened, the top part doesn't remain stable and will fall down a little. If the sides are left closed, the top part stays in place without falling down. 2) If your cat does not enjoy being in the carrier, pushing on the sides of the of the carrier will cause it to flip. Not a major issue and probably not exclusive to this carrier only, but if you need your cat to stay in place, despite fighting to get out of the carrier, then you need to invest in a sturdier carrier.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, but flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and roomy. I actually put two cats in here and they loved stretching out during the flight. However, I was disappointed when I got it because it does not stand up right on its own. It is just cloth and when you have the zipper open, it falls down. There’s no structure. The fabric that goes over the suitcase handle ripped - although I was pulling at it pretty hard.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Pitlosh

customer_reviews.title: Our carry case
customer_reviews.text: My niece has this carrier for her 13lb cat and after exploring every inch, I purchased for my 13 lb dog. The zippers could glide a little easier and I haven't traveled with it yet but I can't wait to put it to use. gives my guy plenty of room and I think it would be fine for trips on planes less that 2 hours. I will see. i like that it can be slipped onto the handle of my rolling luggage so I can zip thru the airport. Nice soft fuzzy liner and padding. very well aerated. will update later when travel complete
customer_reviews.author: Nuala

customer_reviews.title: My Zooey LOVES  even before flight use!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very, very happy, fits on my overhead storable suitcase. Slip on band eliminateds easy often long and exhausting walks to and from gate access in airports as the carrier has a sturdy and rigid platform. Would have loved a camo colored bag to match my luggage, and will readily buy it if available in the future .... hint hint :)... I will add another review after my upcoming Sept/Oct. flights... really love all the features, expandable extra room will be wonderful while having to wait before planing. Remind me?
customer_reviews.author: MaylouMoonflower

customer_reviews.title: Would buy this again and again
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! Got it since I got a second puppy and needed an extra space to kennel her away from big brother until she gets bigger. This bag is prefect, tons of zippers to open it anyway you want. The side liners zip inside to keep the side tents from collapsing into the bag when not expanded and then they fit perfectly into the bottom of the side tents when completely open. It is light and folds down to be compact. I'm recommending this bag to my aunt who flows with her little dogs all the time. It's so much more than I had hoped for!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this case.
customer_reviews.text: Don't trust this case. Got this case in advance to pick up a kitten. Kitten managed to break out from this case in the car in the first use. Was a terrifying moment. Thank God it didn't happen in the train or at flight. I will not recommend you to get this low quality case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian fellow

customer_reviews.title: Cart/trolley version isn't worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: The carrier itself is great and well made however the trolley that comes with one of the options is just terrible. One of the handles doesn't properly attach to the base so You're forced to push the cart awkwardly instead of pulling. It's a good thing I tested this before putting my pup on it. You're better off buying the carrier and getting a trolley separately.
customer_reviews.author: pippers

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for 2 cats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 different types of carriers to travel with 2 cats in the same carrier. This one was perfect. (Insert pun) it fit nicely in my back seat of my car until I could let them out. It’s ok on a plane. A bit of a tight fit but it did work. The expanded sides is a great feature allowing for more space. I recommend it
customer_reviews.author: L ODONNELL

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, zipper broke in flight releasing cat into the plane, what a nightmare. Had to spend $150 in the airport for an emergency replacement. Not a great way to start the move to Shanghai.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too tall for Alaska Air soft-sided carrier
customer_reviews.text: The description says this is approved for Alaska Airlines, but Alaska's website gives the following dimensions for soft-sided carriers: 17" L x 11" W x 9.5" H. At 11.5" H, this carrier is too tall for Alaska Air. Other than that, it seems to be of decent construction, but will not serve my needs unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: qo

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog, happy master!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 lb Pomeranian finally has a McMansion of his own. Genius flap designs in both sides that zip easily for extra square footage! Also handy little slip for going on top of rolled bags is also so helpful. Inside feels & looks comfy too. My dog loves it, plenty of room for him to stand, roll over, & do all his yoga too! Highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: ankles

customer_reviews.title: sturdy but small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I wanted a small carrier for my cat to travel in the car, and I especially liked the expanding sides. It seems sturdy and is comfortably padded. However, it is just too small. My medium size cat can't even stand up in it. I feel that it's cruel that a person would make their pet spend hours crammed in a box this small under an airline seat. I sent it back and ordered something larger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Style but...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the style of this carrier for my cat because of its roomy space and convenience to use for travel. However, when I tried to put my cat in it (with a little struggle - he hates carriers), he managed to escape by nudging his head and the top zipper opened up. Had the zippers been heavy duty ones, it would have been an excellent choice to have as a carrier and I would have given a 5-star rating! I look forward to a more improved product soon. <:
customer_reviews.author: Dina C.

customer_reviews.title: I decided to spend a little more to get a good quality one
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this to fly my cat across the country for a move. I decided to spend a little more to get a good quality one, and I liked the idea that you can expand it for long waits in the airport. I just opened it, and both zippers on the expandable sides split the minute I opened it to see how the sides come out. Both zippers. The zipper on the front and top seem okay, but for $40, I feel like this shouldn't be an issue. I'm likely going to return this as I can't risk having the zippers bust open on an already stressful trip. Poorly constructed and overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.T.

customer_reviews.title: What I love: the fact that it expands to create more ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it several times now, the first of which was for a very long two-day move halfway across the country with my cat. What I love: the fact that it expands to create more room, the mesh parts that allow you to see in, the two different zipper openings for entry (the top one is the only way I can get my cat in for trips to the vet), the pocket in the back, and the comfort and ease of using the carrying straps. The only thing that could make this better is some kind of strap or mechanism to be able to buckle the carrier in for car trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amar

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a let down
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for my chinchilla. It was meant to transport them to the vet and if they needed to travel anywhere. It didn’t work for my needs and pieces were missing (straps and bowl) in the package. The zippers kept popping open and that isn’t something that can happen with rodents. I sadly will be returning it. The inside is soft fur like material so I’m not sure how easy it would be to clean.
customer_reviews.author: tatiana magana

customer_reviews.title: Great bag with minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: This airline kennel is perfect for flying your pet. The inside seem very cozy and all sides have mesh which is great so the animal can see you and also has a lot of air flow. The bag also has a sturdy bottom so I felt like my pet was secure. The only down side is my dog was able to push her nose against a zipper and the zipper came undone. I was able to rezip it closed, but I don’t know if it is because the zipper is weak or something else. Other than that, I love the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N.

customer_reviews.title: Really great carrier!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier was a godsend on a recent round trip long flight with change of planes. My dog is 12 pounds and he fit very comfortably and he was able to move around in it. After reaching my destination and in my hotel, I opened up the two side fold outs, and used it as a nighttime kennel. I added another pad to make it more comfy. The wheels and frame quickly come off the bottom which makes the carrier fit in the overhead compartment on the plane. I loved that the wheels spin in all directions making it super easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: R D

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2 dogs and under airplane seat!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fly with my two dogs (8 lbs & 15 lbs). Having wheels is great, but it’s not very sturdy. I made it just fine, but just be aware. The bag fits perfectly under an American airlines 737 plane window seat. One negative is there are no storage compartments really on the bag which is hard. But, overall works pretty good and I would suggest buying it! Fits two pups great and under the seat!
customer_reviews.author: Kixnixo9

customer_reviews.title: It was very comfortable, and full of great features
customer_reviews.text: It was very comfortable, and full of great features, but unfortunately, was not well made! First the spring clips at the end of the shoulder straps failed, and I had to replace them with carabiners. Then, the attachment points for the shoulder strap wore out and almost pulled free from the unit the first time we used it. If I had not noticed it, this would surely have resulted in the carrier falling to the ground and potential serious injury to my pet. I chose to return it. If you do buy this, you are going to have to make several modifications to make it safe...
customer_reviews.author: Tom G

customer_reviews.title: Roomy for our larger cat
customer_reviews.text: The only traveling we do with our cat is short trips to the local vet and cat groomer, so the cat is only in the carrier for relatively short times. However, the groomer noted that she is in better spirits these days since we got the new carrier, and we attribute it to the fact that we expand the sides after placing her in the car, and she is more comfortable/less stressed during the drive. It definitely suits our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Wilson

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 86 year old mother had to fly from CA to NY with her little 14 lb Chug and he did very well. He was able to stick his head out of the top, and while laying down he had great air circulation. It is airline approved and is very sturdy and attractive. We got the red one which looks more cranberry in color but is very pretty. The bottom fleece offers comfort as well and I would purchase this product again but don’t think it will every be necessary because of its sturdiness and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes commuting with a dog super easy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5lb maltese that absolutely loves the bag. I got the size small for her and it was perfect. She sometimes tries to scratch her way out if something sparks her curiosity but otherwise she's comfortable in there. I take her to work sometimes and it makes my commute with her so much easier. Once I get to work I let her out of the bag and I hope up the extension flaps and she hangs out in there.
customer_reviews.author: sabrinagenesish

customer_reviews.title: My big handsome kitty seems to love it, but...
customer_reviews.text: My big handsome kitty seems to love it, he didn't even cry at all when I put him in the carrier, he just laid down and chilled out-he always cried when I put him in the old hard carrier, even with bedding inside. I love how light weight it is. My cat is a big boy he is about 15lbs, 17inches long and close to 11inches high, so I was a little worried that this wasn't gonna work, but it seems to be great. We'll see how it holds up....not so we'll.... Fast forward, only a few months after writing this, the frame is falling apart. The two top metal rods are now exposed and an endangerment to my cat
customer_reviews.author: S. lamb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe how well this product worked out. It was really easy/convenient to carry my cat either on my shoulder or hooked onto my carry-on roller. There was plenty of room for her (10lbs) to move around even with the small blanket we put in with her. It was also easy to take her out/put her back into the carrier while on the airplane. I would 100% recommend this product for air travel.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the sides extend out. This was our first airline trip with our 14.8lb Yorkie. I got the smaller size because she usually curls up anyway and with the size requirements for the airline, I didn’t want to take any chances with her not being able to lay at my feet. I did have to unzip the bag around the top in order to push down on the top of the bag for it to fit under the seat. Once I let the sides out, it gave her the room she needed to move around. The retractable bowl was an added bonus because I just bought a bottled water to fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: Beverlovely Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this crate. Its sturdy, roomy, and built to last. The expandable sides allow for lots of extra room and the attachable wheels are smooth and so convenient for travel. Its easy to fold up for storage but we use it as a bedtime crate for our puppy. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: KRISTI HAMILTON

customer_reviews.title: Fits on Southwest Airlines
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, attractive, nice pockets, fits onto handle of rolling suitcase, comfy carrying straps. Fits (barely) under the seat on southwest.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Case is very well made. I must return it ...
customer_reviews.text: Case is very well made. I must return it because my Cav is 15lb and a little big for the carrier. She can squeeze to turn around. I have debated the return and have decided to do so for the space reason and because I do not believe it will fit underneath most airline and train seats. I suspect "Airline Approved" means it will definitely fit in the above the seat luggage area, but who wants to carry their pet there? It would be a helpful design feature if they made one of the side supports removable.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful design, substandard execution
customer_reviews.text: The idea of an expandable carrier is brilliant! We also greatly appreciated the collapsible bowl. However, the hardware, especially the zippers, seem cheap and not sturdy. Because the carrier can collapse to a flat shape (another good idea), the zippers are important and will inevitably be used very frequently. As much as I appreciated the relatively low price for such an innovative carrier, I would have preferred to pay a bit more for sturdy hardware. My Sherpa carriers have lasted years; I'm afraid this one won't last 2 trips.
customer_reviews.author: Janey P

customer_reviews.title: Good, but didn't stand the test.
customer_reviews.text: The carrier is very pretty, looks modern, stylish and sturdy. I only have a problem the stability. When and if the carrier is NOT zipped up on both ends it will collapse, the body of the carrier has no enforcements. The reinforcements are in the doors and not the main body of the carrier. They say you will get a portable pet bowl, they included a pair of what I will say looked liked a pair of children's nail clippers/scissors! Even if I didn't send it back I would never use the tiny scissors they looked like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: ReroeMom

product_meta.title: Premium Airline Approved Expandable Pet Carrier by Pet Peppy- Expandable Ends, Designed for Cats, Dogs, Kittens,Puppies - Extra Spacious Soft Sided Carrier!
feature_bullets: AIRLINE APPROVED PET CARRIER: Dont you think your pet deserves the same kind of love and care in an airplane that it gets from you at home. With the PetPeppy Double Expandable Pet Carrier your pet can now travel safely while lying down with utmost comfort and safety throughout the journey. Expertly crafted roof ventilation design allows for air circulation, keeping your pet from overheating and providing fresh supply of oxygen at all times. Easily stow away under the cabin seat.

SUPERIOR QUALITY: This masterfully crafted airline pet carrier tote is made from high quality safe, eco friendly and durable materials. The result, you can now easily travel with your furry little one with utmost peace of mind. Features removable plush faux fleece bedding, padded shoulder strap and spacious extra storage compartments.﻿ The pristine grade nylon material is lightweight, durable and sturdy, ensuring no hassle reliance day after day, use after use, air mile after air mile.

DOUBLE EXPANDABLE DUAL ENTRY DESIGN: What good is a travel pet carrier if it isnt convenient. Double zippers on top and side allows for easy entrance from both sides. The high quality zippers don’t snag and arent accessible to the pet inside. The dual expansion feature makes it a breeze to fold down, unzip one or both sides to create extra room for the pet depending on your furry little ones size. Includes a comfortable washable liner and a leash ring inside to keep your pet secure. Enjoy the peace of mind that comes without any hassle.

BONUS AND EXTRA STORAGE: Our extra bonuses and generous storage space make this airline approved pet carrier a must have. Includes an adorable random colored pet bowl, so your furry little munchkin can feed in style. The soft padded shoulder strap easily lets you carry your pet like any other carry on luggage. The gentle faux fleece bedding is plush, comfortable and easy to wash. The extra storage and pockets allow plenty of room for pet treats, toys, food and other essentials.

NO RISK PURCHASE: Pet Peppy is a truly remarkable company offering one of the absolute best travel pet carrier totes on the market. Buy with utmost confidence. If for any reason you arent happy, simply contact us and we will refund the product for you. 100 percent without risk. Zero hassles, zero waits. Add to Cart now and join thousands of satisfied pet owners worldwide.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
